description: Crystal Palace Bowl is a South London icon: A venue of legends from Pink Floyd to Bob Marley, with a Stirling Prize nominated sculptural stage, revived from ruin by a local community campaign and ready to host the next generation of talent!

factsheet.heading: History
paragraphs: Crystal Palace Park has a long association with live music going back more than 160 years. From the famous Handel Festivals at the original Palace, to the popular Garden Party Festivals of the 1970s and '80s at Crystal Palace Bowl. Known as the 'Suburban Woodstock' these saw legendary names like Pink Floyd, Elton John, Bob Marley and the Beach Boys liven up the leafy environs of SE19.

In 1997 a new permanent stage was commissioned for the Bowl. Ian Ritchie Architects won a competition with their striking and sculptural design clad in corten steel â€“ its first use on a public building in the UK. A nominee for the 1998 Stirling Prize and winner of multiple architectural awards, the stage has since become a much loved local landmark, affectionately known as the 'Rusty Laptop'.
 
However ater away being dormant for more than a decade, by 2018 it had fallen into a state of disrepair and was at risk of being lost altogether.

factsheet.heading: Community Comeback
paragraphs: A community campaign was launched to revive the venue, culminating in the hugely succesful #BackTheBowl crowdfunder in 2021 .This attracted more than 1,000 backers and won the support of the Mayor of London, kickstarting a  restoration of the stage. South Facing Festival launched the same summer, finally bringing world class acts back to the Palace.

Now under the management of the charitable Crystal Palace Park Trust, there are exciting plans to make the Bowl a truly vibrant and versatile venue, one that will be unique in London: combining popular largescale events, with smaller scale arts and community focussed programming.
This is a rare opportunity to gain access the structure, learn more about its extraordinary history and follow in the footsteps of legends by stepping on stage!
